intro: Magnistipula cupheiflora subsp. cupheiflora, commonly known as the cupheiflora magnistipula, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is characterized by its hairy stems and palmate leaves with serrated edges. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
